answers.answer: It's an old wives tale.  You're gonna **** all night long, that's it. You're almost there, you can do it!
then why am i reading it makes some people go into labor? if i already have sotmach problems (acid reflux, gastroparesis) should i just not take it?

Castor oil .. I've tried it..... But I dont think I drank enough because all it did was give me horrible stomach cramps.. And that's what it is meant to do.... Some people say if you drink alot of it, it will throw you into contractions and you'll go into labor.......

Why don't you just ask to be induced? You're considered full term at 37 weeks. If you are puking blood, then your doctor really needs to weigh the option to induce.Do you really want to go into labor with diarrhea and stomach pains and then be too sick to even hold your baby? Just ask to be induced.
LOL... Good point... You'd be in too much pain! It gives you HORRIBLE cramps, and you will **** your brains out and then some.

these doctors act like nothing is wrong. they even witnessed the blood and dont care. to be honest, the only thing that has stoped me from puking these whole nine months is a hit of pot once in a while. their **** like phenergan, zofran, reglan, NOTHING works, even in the IV most of the time. Once, they had to literally KNOCK ME OUT to stop me or i was going to die. i tried to call my primary doctor to get him to do something and he wont cuz he hasnt been seeing me for the pregnancy, even though he too once witnessed phenergan not working. i dont know what to do i am so mentally exauhsted i want to die.

Castor oil is not something you can eat. I'm sorry but that is awful. You're going to rip a hole in your stomach. I think it'll make your situation worse, not better!At your next appointment say, "I want to schedule to be induced this week/next week." Just keep saying it until they finally schedule it. This is beyond miserable. You're in a desperate situation and are about to do something very desperate that can harm you.They will try to talk you out of induction. Just tell them they better do it!

With your history, I can't imagine why they wouldn't let you be induced. It's just rotten to make you keep going thru this, you're supposed to enjoy your pregnancy darnit!!! A very good friend of mine tried castor oil, and according to her, it worked. BUT, with your history, especially acid reflux and all the meds, do not try it!! You will be so miserable, you won't get to enjoy what little bit you do have left, and hopefully, you have a half-way decent labor. Have you considered threatening to change docs if they don't let you induce?? Doctors really hate that, and won't like the idea, but if you insist that you just can't do this anymore, and you're willing to do that, they might cave. It might be worth a shot....Good luck to you, I hope all goes well.
ok i will make an appointment tomorrow and i will force them to induce me. if they dont, i will tell them to transfer my files elsewhere. thanks.
wait...do i have the right to be induced???

Of course you do!! You are far enough along, and it's your health, and your baby's health that you're concerned with!! Like, njeosys said earlier, you're considered full term at 37weeks, they really can't argue with you.  Good luck, and keep us posted about what you find out!!

are you serious? because they are acting like i HAVE to keep going and going. even my gastroenterologist knnows i keep LITERALLY NOTHING down. i have to eat to stop the hunger, which i usually dotn get cuz i am nautious or puking. i dont even know how my son made it this far. so what exactly do i say? i am only 20 years old and doctors DONT listen to me they give me the run-around. not only do i have these problems, but i also have a bad heart. a mitral valve prolapse and atrial fibrillation. they're always saying they're concerned about the baby....but they dont care about me apparently! its like, how is the baby healthy when i eat no food? anyways, how do i tell them i am done being sick i want him out?

You have the right to be induced from this point on. Twins are induced early and there are TWO of them so they are even tinier than what a singleton would be at the time they are delivered.Just draw up your argument with your doc. and tell them "I CANNOT DO THIS ANYMORE!"Will the vomiting stop after the pregnancy is over?

yes, the reason i vomit so much is due to the reflux, gastroparesis and the baby pushing up on my stomach. i always had stomach problems, but not EVERY DAY ALL DAY until i was 9 weeks pregnant and i couldnt move and my heart rate was up to 180. my gastro doc is going to go in witha  scope and make sure there are no blockages, cancer, or ulcers. i have one more ? though, lately when i walk my legs feel like they hurt and they get numb. is this part of braxton hicks or could i have that blood pressure stuff? cuz its only when i am standing up or walking.

You sit there, square your shoulders, and say, "Look, I'm sick of you people not being concerned about me, yes, the baby is important, but ultimately, if I'm not healthy, neither is my baby! I want to be induced before I lose my mind, or I will go to another specialist that will give me what I want". If you have to, call your PCP, and find out if you can get some kind of a referral, and tell them what you want to do. Maybe they can write something up for you saying they think you should be either induced or referred. Put your foot down, the only reason they are making you keep going, is because the docs always like to see a woman go "full term", which, from what I've seen with alot of women, is 2 weeks over...yuck!  You have the right, don't let them push you around and bully you. Hopefully the threatening will work, and of course, just tell them you've done research and know that it's a safe time to take the baby. You shouldn't have to deal with this anymore!!

http://www.americanpregnancy.org/labornbirth/inducinglabor.htmlEverything I'm finding on induction says that a pregnancy should be induced if there is a risk to the fetus or mother to continue the pregnancy. They all say that a baby should be delivered if it'll survive better outside the womb.There is a risk you'll have to have a c-section if the induction doesn't go through (sometimes it doesn't work... you'll have to read up on it because there's too much info on it for me to type up). Once they break your water, you have to deliver within 24 hours to reduce the risk of infection.

The numb and tingling legs are either do to a pinched sciatic nerve (which runs from your butt down your leg) or it could be blood clots (WHICH HAVE TO BE DEALT WITH). Usually, if this is thrombophlebitis, you would feel a localized area of tenderness, perhaps redness or pain down the leg.Most likely it is sciatic nerve pain and it's just one of those pregnancy things you can't do much about. Put a warming pad on your lower back, legs (NOT your tummy).

I've had 2 c-sections, and have this one scheduled already, and just in case the thought of that scares you, please don't freak out about it. My gf is 4 weeks further than me, and she has preeclampsia, and her baby is breech, and she's having a "heart attack" at the thought of it!!! If there are risks to you or your child, and they offer it at all, please don't hesitate or have bad feelings about it. I just wanted to throw that in there, just in case ;)

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH. i am going to go to my ob tomorrow and demand they take the baby out. if that doesnt work i am going to go to my gastro doctor and make him refer them to take him out. thanks so much for the tips.
TELL US WHAT HAPPENS
i will i promise

question: i am 37 weeks pregnant, and i have had hyperemesis the WHOLE time. puking EVERY day sometimes to the point where i puke blood. i am DONE with this ******** and all the stupid meds tehy give me that dont work. I just bought Castor oil....how much do i drink? and how do i know if it is even going to work or if it's an old wives tale?
title: castor oil
